summary: Armor Size Mastery allows you to create Light Versions of Heavy Armor and Heavy Versions of Light Armors.
descriptionHtml:
Have you ever wanted to wear Deadric Armor, but couldn\'t because you\'re a Light Armor character? What about Elven Armor, but couldn\'t because it\'s Light Armor and you want to be a Heavy Armor character?  Well now this problem is a thing of the past!! Introducing: Armor Size Mastery!  This mod allows you to make Light Versions of Heavy Armors, and Heavy Versions of Light Armors!!! Now you can wear whatever armor you want, regardless of what armor skill you\'re focusing on! 

Features:
Light Versions of Heavy Armors
Heavy Versions of Light Armors
All variations of the Armors have their Crafting Materials, Armor Ratings and Weights scaled in a way I found balanced.
All new Armors are able to be upgraded at a crafting table.
All new Armors are able to be enchanted.

*New in 2.0*
All Armors are now part of the Leveled Lists. This means they will now drop as Random Loot!


Included:
V1.1
Ancient Nordic Light Armor (Skyforge Armor) Can be crafted at the Skyforge only!
Wolf Light Armor (Non-Craftable) Can be purchased from Eorlund Gray-Mane at the Skyforge.

V1
Deadric Light Armor and Shield
DragonPlate Light Armor and Shield
DragonScale Heavy Armor and Shield
Dwarven Light Armor and Shield
Ebony Light Armor and Shield
Elven Heavy Armor and Shield
Glass Heavy Armor and Shield
Iron Light Armor and Shield
Orcish Light Armor and Shield
Steel Light Armor and Shield
Steel Plate Light Armor and Shield

Not Included (and reasosn why):
Hide (Hide is soft)
Leather (It\'s made of Leather, can\'t get much heavier)
Studded (There was only one thing)

======================
2. Installation
======================
To Install Armor Size Mastery, place in your Skyrim/Data folder.  


======================
3. Uninstallation
======================
Make sure that your characters DO NOT have any versions of the armor this mod creates, failure to do so could cause unforseen consequences.  Then, remove the .esp from your Skyrim/Data folder.


======================
4. Usage
======================
Go to any smithy and craft the pieces of armor that you want! The pieces will appear in their appropriate category (aka Steel Light Armor will be in the Steel Armor Category)


======================
5. Incompatibilities
======================
As this adds new items to the catalog, it should be compatible with anything.  If you come across a problem let me know!!
author: Twitish
